text: This trailer only covers 2/3 of the book about Louie Z.  Per Louie himself, the *actual point* of the book is revealed in the last 1/3 of the book --- and it has nothing to do with who treated whom worse in WWII, nor which country deserved what and it has zero to do with the dozens of issues in the posts below. In the last 1/3 of the book, and in countless TV interviews of Louie Z himself (which you can find on YouTube) and in his own best-selling autobiography from the 1950s, Louie said the *Big Picture point* of his story is simply this --- that the power of *forgiveness*, born out of faith and a *love* for one’s fellow human beings, is the most powerful gift to heal the souls of victims and perpetrators. Louie said this is what *saved* his life AFTER he got home to the U.S. when the war ended --- it saved him from *PTSD*, saved him from *alcoholism*, saved his *marriage*, saved him from taking out his *pain* on others & drove him to *give back* to his community and country. Forgiveness and a love for humanity --- you’d think everyone could rally behind these.  Unfortunately, they seem to be in short supply in the world as evidenced by some of the posts about this movie.
